input_text:
Job Title: Mechanical Assembler (3rd shift) - DOD SkillBridge

Location: Oxnard, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Mercury is proud to offer this opportunity to active US military service members as a SkillBridge internship position. Mercury is a DOD Contract manufacturer providing state of the art technology to support those who defend our country everyday. To further this partnership, Mercury is proud to offer career opportunities to those who have served our country.

Mercury is an approved company for the SkillBridge Program under Dept. of Defense Instruction 1322.29. This program is an opportunity for transitioning service members to gain valuable civilian work experience through an individual internship during their last 6 months of service, for up to 180 days. Mercury SkillBridge is open to all ranks and experience levels provided they meet the minimum requirements for the position listed below. SkillBridge participants are not eligible for compensation from Mercury, as they continue to receive military compensation and benefits as Active-duty service members. For full SkillBridge eligibility please visit the SkillBridge website at https://skillbridge.osd.mil/faq.htm

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Perform a variety of tasks relating to production operations on electronic and/or mechanical assemblies and subassemblies.

You are responsible for

Working from diagrams and drawingsUsing hand and/or power tools and jigs.Making continuity checks on work in process and completed. May conduct quality inspections on processing line in accordance with quality specifications.May disassemble, modify, rework, reassemble, and test experimental or prototype assemblies and subassemblies according to specifications and under simulated conditions.Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

3+ years of related experienceStrong assembly skillsAbility to execute on all procedures, processes and work instructionsStrong knowledge of hand tools and their proper applicationMust be able to meet quality and quantity production requirementsHigh School Degree or equivalent requiredMust be a US citizen with an active DOD secret clearance or have the ability to obtain one

Preferred Qualifications

Experience using Factory Logix preferred but not requiredStrong organizational and time management skillsMust be detailed orientedStrong communication skillsExperience using Microsoft OfficeEffectively learn and stay up to date on product configurations and best practices

Full-Time Equivalent Annual Salary Range: $32,240 - $48,000 for a Non-Technical Int Specialist at Oxnard CA USA

Why should you join Mercury Systems? Mercury Systems is a technology company that makes the world a safer, more secure place. We push processing power to the tactical edge, making the latest commercial technologies profoundly more accessible for today's most challenging aerospace and defense missions. From silicon to system scale, Mercury enables customers to accelerate innovation and turn data into decision superiority. Headquartered in Andover, Massachusetts, Mercury employs more than 2,300 people in 24 locations worldwide. To learn more, visit mrcy.com 

Our Culture We are committed to making Mercury a great place to work, no matter where our employees are located. We offer a casual and enjoyable atmosphere that allows employees to learn and grow. We help and care for one another and work as one to achieve results for us and for our customers. We value communication and transparency, and strive to foster two-way dialogue at all levels of the organization. We are committed to lifelong learning, offering comprehensive skills training and tuition reimbursement. Whether you're just starting out on your career journey or you are an experienced professional, it's important to us that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions. To find out more about Why Mercury?, or visit the Mercury Community or find answers to general questions at Mercury FAQs Mercury Systems is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status. As an equal opportunity employer, Mercury Systems is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact the number below. (978) 256-1300

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Mechanical Assembler (3rd shift) - DOD SkillBridge
output_json.summary: Active US military service members can apply for this SkillBridge internship position at Mercury, a DOD Contract manufacturer.
job_responsibilities: Perform tasks related to production operations on electronic and/or mechanical assemblies and subassemblies.
Use hand and/or power tools and jigs.
Conduct continuity checks on work in process and completed.
May conduct quality inspections on processing line.
Disassemble, modify, rework, reassemble, and test experimental or prototype assemblies and subassemblies.
Meet quality and quantity production requirements.
High School Degree or equivalent required.
US citizen with an active DOD secret clearance or ability to obtain one.
output_json.company_information: Mercury Systems is a technology company that provides state-of-the-art technology to support the defense of the country. It offers career opportunities to service members through the SkillBridge program.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Mercury Systems is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. It offers comprehensive skills training and tuition reimbursement.
